Row.Text: Grants a copy of the [ICON_RES_JFD_PRALINE] Praline luxury resource.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must have a Circus.

The Chocolaterie is the unique Belgian replacement for the Zoo. Unlike the Zoo, the Chocolaterie does not produce any [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness by itself. Instead, it provides a copy of the unique [ICON_RES_JFD_PRALINE] Praline resource, which yields [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness like other luxury resources. The Chocolaterie also increases the [ICON_GOLD] Gold yield of plantation-based resources and reduces [ICON_HAPPINESS_3] Boredom.
Grants a copy of the [ICON_RES_JFD_PRALINE] Praline luxury resource.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]City must have a Tavern.

The Chocolaterie is the unique Belgian replacement for the Menagerie. Unlike the Menagerie, the Chocolaterie does not produce any [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness by itself. Instead, it provides a copy of the unique [ICON_RES_JFD_PRALINE] Praline resource, which yields [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness like other luxury resources and may be traded to other civilizations. It also increases the [ICON_GOLD] Gold yield of plantation-based resources.
Our people are now eating your chocolate and reading your comic books. I worry the rest of the world will also succumb to the influence of your culture.

Maintaining foreign colonies often involves ensuring that the native population knows who's in charge. Incompetency and non-productivity should not be tolerated. Creating a military force to oversee our economic quotas would make Belgium very prosperous indeed.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Requirement/Restrictions: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be Belgium [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted from the beginning of the Industrial Era [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per game [NEWLINE]Costs: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]1 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrates [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production on Plantations.

Maintaining foreign colonies often involves ensuring that the native population knows who's in charge. Incompetency and non-productivity should not be tolerated. Creating a military force to oversee our economic quotas would make Belgium very prosperous indeed.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]+1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production on Plantations.

It is important that Belgium not fall behind its rivals in power. Calling together the world's leading experts on exploratory science would put us leagues ahead of other empires in the race to further our reach.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Requirement/Restrictions: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be Belgium [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted from the beginning of the Renaissance Era [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per game [NEWLINE]Costs: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Num} [ICON_GOLD] Gold [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]2 {2_ResourceType} [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Settlers and Workers gain +1 Sight and ignore terrain costs when moving.

It is important that Belgium not fall behind its rivals in imperial power. Calling together the world's leading experts on exploratory science would put us leagues ahead of other empires in the race to further our reach.[NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Settlers and Workers gain +1 Sight and ignore terrain costs when moving.
Ignores terrain cost and gains +1 Sight.
{1_LeaderName} has called together the Brussels Geographic Conference in {2_CivName}.
People in {1_CityName} have begun attaching wheels to their shoes and 'skating' around the city! There is sure to be a rise in accidents.

Recently, a group of {1_Language}-speaking Belgians have caused a stir by demanding equal representation of their language in the courts. They see the omission of their language to convey Belgian laws as an affront to their protection beneath those same laws. We must act to resolve this issue before it gets out of hand.[NEWLINE]
Very well. There shall be equal use of the languages within the courts.
Absolutely not. Dutch is the language of our laws and so it shall stay.
We have resolved linguistic tensions within our nation by establishing equal representation of our languages within the courts.
We have dismissed the tensions caused by linguistic divisions in the country.
Tensions between {1_Language} and Dutch-speaking citizens have sparked division in {2_CivName}.
It has been a profitable year for our plantation industry, and we have reaped a hefty surplus.[NEWLINE]
It has been a profitable year for our plantation industry.
The plantations in {1_CivDesc} are reporting record-high profits this year.
